content.body:
Need help with streams!
How do I find the byte size of a chunk, or the total bytes written/read so far?
I need to understand the total byte-size of the stream once it's flushed (it's for https://github.com/w3c/navigation-timing/issues/124).

Maybe Mattias Buelens?

Maybe Mattias Buelens?

Need help with streams!

content.formatted_body:
In reply to @noamr:matrix.org

Need help with streams!
How do I find the byte size of a chunk, or the total bytes written/read so far?
I need to understand the total byte-size of the stream once it's flushed (it's for https://github.com/w3c/navigation-timing/issues/124).

Maybe Mattias Buelens?

The idiomatic solution would be to pipe it through a TransformStream that adds up the byteLength of each chunk.

let totalBytes = 0;
const transform = new TransformStream({
  transform(chunk, controller) {
      totalBytes += chunk.byteLength;
      controller.enqueue(chunk);
  },
  flush() {
      console.log(`Downloaded ${totalBytes} bytes`);
  }
});

content.body: The streams spec just uses the `[[ByteLength]]` internal slot from ECMA-262 directly. But I *think* Web IDL now has a helper for this.
content.formatted_body: The streams spec just uses the [[ByteLength]] internal slot from ECMA-262 directly. But I think Web IDL now has a helper for this.

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: The streams spec just uses the `[[ByteLength]]` internal slot from ECMA-262 directly. But I *think* Web IDL now has a helper for this.
The streams spec just uses the [[ByteLength]] internal slot from ECMA-262 directly. But I think Web IDL now has a helper for this.

content.body: Ah, here it is: https://webidl.spec.whatwg.org/#buffersource-byte-length

(Oh, btw, adding a TransformStream to a pipe chain currently _always_ increases the "total buffer" of the chain by at least one chunk. Ideally you want an _unbuffered_ transform stream if you only count the total bytes, but that requires https://github.com/whatwg/streams/pull/1190)
content.formatted_body: (Oh, btw, adding a TransformStream to a pipe chain currently always increases the "total buffer" of the chain by at least one chunk. Ideally you want an unbuffered transform stream if you only count the total bytes, but that requires https://github.com/whatwg/streams/pull/1190)

Ideally you want an _unbuffered_ transform stream if you only count the total bytes, but that requires https://github.com/whatwg/streams/pull/1190)

(Oh, btw, adding a TransformStream to a pipe chain currently always increases the "total buffer" of the chain by at least one chunk. Ideally you want an unbuffered transform stream if you only count the total bytes, but that requires https://github.com/whatwg/streams/pull/1190)

content.body: rollback(), as well as deleteForwardEntries() from https://github.com/WICG/app-history/issues/9, are in the category of "in theory, not hard, but haven't made it to the top of the priority list"
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: rollback(), as well as deleteForwardEntries() from https://github.com/WICG/app-history/issues/9, are in the category of "in theory, not hard, but haven't made it to the top of the priority list"

content.body: navigateto/navigatefrom/finished events are also in theory not hard, but in practice there are so many events already firing on each navigation that it's going to be a bit annoying to slot them in.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: navigateto/navigatefrom/finished events are also in theory not hard, but in practice there are so many events already firing on each navigation that it's going to be a bit annoying to slot them in.

content.body: And nobody has complained about any of these missing yet... it's more that they seem like good ideas.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: And nobody has complained about any of these missing yet... it's more that they seem like good ideas.
